reviews.review_msg: Vasyl is good at explaining concepts, however, it would be nice if he used slides instead of projecting his scribbly handwritten notes on the screen.

This class felt like it was made in the 50s before professors had access to technology. The lack of actual teaching in this course is baffling. The standard of teaching in this course would be too low for Somalia. The fact that SFU is contempt with this level of teaching shows why they're in a financial crisis. Nice guy though

Quizzes gave you two attempts which was nice. Assignments weren't that hard. Unfortunately terrible professor and awful course designer. Really didn't feel like this course had a professor even, rather feeling like everyone just had a textbook, and had to figure it out

Does not provide any kind of notes, I would never take his classes ever again. His classes were confusing and basically told you to learn from a textbook, doesn't provide actual help for getting through this course.

He was the worst professor I have ever studied before. He's tough in grading. There were no activities during online class and no sense of motivation while you were studying. some professors motivate you to pass the course or involve you in some kind of activities regarding the course but he doesn't do anything like this.

Taking this during COVID. Worst prof. Very thick accent hard to understand. Absolutely horrible lectures, doesnt practically teach you relatable course material. You need to self-teach on google. Midterm questions werent taught in class not directly from the textbook. Hes SO LAZY and doesnt physically teach/make slides. Doesnt reply to emails.

I studied my behind off and got a B+ no thanks to this prof. I went to every lecture and it's really useless 8:30 in the morning. He sends out practice questions like 2 days BEFORE THE EXAM, that's really helpful.. If you have him just pay attention to those questions he sends it's on the exams

Nice prof and fair exams. He is very knowledged. He knows a lot and I think he is really want to teach us all he knows, that is why he talk fast and sometimes run out of topic.  Anyway, he is a good prof.
His exams are long and hard to finish...Some questions are based on what he talked about in class and not in the book or notes... and he doesn't double check his equations before exam... horrible
Boring lecture, irresponsible TAs, bad marking scheme, disorganized instructor and unfair exams.......what can you expect? better study by yourself buddy..

He has to work hard on his presenting skill! he talks way too fast.It's super hard to follow him. Plus, he's not well prepared for the class. He uploads his lecture notes a few days after his lecture.you cannot study ahead and you have no idea what he's going to teach because he's not following his syllabus.exams=unfair&impossible to finish

His lecture is quite useless and he talks really fast. He shows you bunch of graphs that you won't be tested in lecture and you never know which chapter he 's teaching. Everything is so not organized and his syllabus is useless. You will find something new in your exams, Duh!! Exams was unfair...lots of typo...not recommended

I don't know about you guys but I didn't finish the midterm today.... In a 2 hour exam time, 1 hour into the exam "We have a mistake in #1" WHOLE class sighs and groans 20mins left in exam "We have a mistake in #3" ..... REALLY?

You should be fine if you are prepared to self-study. That way you probably can save two hours of your week too unless you are particularly drawn to a self-absorbed guy mumbling information to himself in an elusive air.  However if you're in for some solid grounding for your Economics career and need a boost from somebody, avoid at all cost.
Never replied to emails and is certainly poor with time management. Does not seem to care about the class at all. I would never recommend this prof.
He never respond any emails and seems not care about the class at all.

The course is getting harder and harder in the later of the semester. Midterm is fair. Yet, the final is really hard, I was working until the last minutes. The prof is really nice though! She was running around answering questions during all exams. Also, sometimes she will add more information based the lecture notes. Will take again for sure!

Horrible teaching. 1) Fills in the blanks for her lectures for 2 hours, on pre printed lecture notes. 2) Doesn't reply to emails 3) Not helpful 4) Brutal Exams. Midterm 1  42% avg, Midterm 2  51% avg. Class size 56   5) Dumbest TA's I have ever had. Do NOT know how to mark or explain material. Her class makes you hate econ. Avoid her if you can.

All the notes are fill in the blank from the textbook. She doesnt teach it, she just fills in the blanks for the 1hr 30 mins of lecture, and talks about what she fills in. 1. Doesnt reply to emails, not helpful. 2. Can't teach 3. Brutal exams.. class avg overall was 59% for 30 students...

Don't like her teaching style, it is like reading the lecture notes. Her midterm is very different from what I expect. Once you didn't prove calculation steps, she will give you zero at that question. Even that's very simple questions, and even all your answers are right!

She's a nice prof but I think she made the course harder this term - avg was only 50% for first midterm; course covers ALOT of material; TAs spoonfeed you everything (HOW IS THIS LEARNING?!) questions not encouraged. im disappointed.

Indeed, the final exam is much harder than midterm and harder than what I ever expected. But she is a good teacher and this courses give grade on curve.  She is a nice guy and helpful. She just needs more teaching experience and Shes young.I hope she can give more realistic example like the one in final exam during the lecture.

DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE. Bad English.  U can't read his hand writing. don't need to listen his lecture, if u took econ 103 or 105 before. he will only confuses u He does the pop quizzes at the very beginning of the class and if he likes you he will let you retake a quiz even if you are late. but if not, he won't even give you quiz paper to study.

Very nice guy, not the best speaker. He basically explains the textbook for you in lecture which I found quite helpful. when I try to study, my class notes match the textbook materials and it saved me a lot of time.  Go to his office hours ask him about how he would answer assignment questions and do exactly the same on the exam you will get an A.
he is very nice and helpful and always care about his students.i would like to take his course again!
always skipped class. but easy exams for Econ 291. If you wanna have a higher mark, take this..but he wont' reuse his paper coz' his exams were just from the note.
Nobody in class laughs at his jokes but he's a pretty funny guy. He talks very loud, it is amusing but he is quite clear in his lectures. Heavy textbook use. Difficult.

Had lectures online but attending is quite useful because he writes the notes on the projector. Lecture notes and text go almost hand in hand. It's frustrating that he doesn't curve even when the second midterm average was extremely low. Fairly good at explaining economic concepts.

he is new. his notes are extremely unclear and messy. i wouldn't recommend him if you didn't ace your econ 100 level courses. he is willing to help though didn't do a good job in explaining the theories.

His exams are fair if you practice past midterms and finals. Qs are very similar. Read his notes and the blue sections in the textbook and you'll be fine. I did well on MT1, failed MT2, and ended up with an A-, so it's possible to do well even if you bomb one midterm. Also, he's really approachable so ask questions!

Geoff's lectures are very interesting.  The class is worth it just for those.  He doesn't spoon feed the material.  Self-directed studying is a must.  Questions on exams really test if you've acquired the knowledge, rather than just memorized facts.  Nice guy all around.
Of course you have to read the textbook carefully and the lecture notes. He's exam was pretty hard.
very interesting lectures.  helpful and fair guy.
very easy course. You don't need to buy the text book because he does not use the text at all! Just read his lecture slides and you will do find on the midterms and final.

not monotone, great voice....don't go to class if you don't want to, just read the book, but make sure you analyze the graph; there are only so many different variables they can adjust for questions, so just understand how things shift.
I don't have much say about Geoff because I did not go to class at all, but TA Sascha was extremly helpful. If you understand IS-LM curve, you will get a good mark.
Spoke very clearly...but very monotoned.  He is extremely knowledgeable in Economics.  Speaks very fast.  Notes are long...but is a must to pass the course.
really easy prof. notes are a mess and rants like there's no tomorrow. something about his voice is hypnotic and makes me zone out almost immediately and/or fall asleep.

Hated this course but got a good grade. Just because of that doesn't necessarily mean Dunbar is a good prof. Notes were jumping all over the place from chapters to another, they are not even in a chronological order. Gives you a lot of notes to copy down and expects you to listen to his nonstop yapping. Overall, poor prof but TAs were easy going.

His exams are reasonably hard, but shouldn't be a problem for those who focus on real-life economic events. Good thing is the course only got 2 MTs and a final, but 2 bad things attached: mts are only given an hr, and his order of teaching is confusing (syllabus is outdated, and ch are not taught in order). Also hes got bad handwriting!

Seems pretty knowledgeable about the subject but I hardly ever listen to him talk in class because I'm always too busy copying down his notes. In the 2nd half of the course he actually handwrites the notes on the overhead slides.bI spend half the time trying to figure out what he wrote... His midterm exams are fair though...

Wish he told us about midterms earlier. But his notes are a good indication of what is to be expected on the midterms. I found them fair and simple and the TA marking them was generous. Enjoyed this class even though there was way to much info in long lecs. Lots of examples related to current events. Was it honestly that hard?....
I regret taking this class with him...it should be an easy class.  btw I'm wondering if some of the good comments here about him are written by himself.

The midterm was fair and had an average of about 72. I barely even opened my textbook and just from his notes I was able to score in the 80s. Learn how to take proper notes people. You don't have to copy everything word for word. His voice is far from monotone and the tangents into real world examples are very helpful in understanding the material.

The midterm was a killer!...he said studying the notes would be enough but there was sth that's not in the notes but in the textbook on the exam...my god why are you doing this...  and he didn't even tell us there was lecture before the midterm...

Simply put, if you want to experience the boredom of economics, and/or get yourself killed, come to his class. If you don't want to believe what I said, it's ok. However, don't ever complain once you are in his class.

He gives us the wrong course outline and doesn't correct it.  Who the heck knows what he'll be teaching the following lecture?  Unbelievably unorganized! Told us the midterm date could be on week6 but not it's on week8. Thanks Geof, now I have 2 midterms on the same day, and technically 4 midterms on a single week.

This guy gives lecture notes which are not posted online...and they are too much for me to copy. My hands are always sore after every class. He also keeps on talking while we are copying the notes. Who has the time to focus on what he's saying. In addition, he also asks why no one's asking him questions. What can i say? definitely overrated!

I haven't taken the midterms so I'll not comment on his exams. I have no idea why the previous ppl rate him so high, but in my opinion he sucks.  He doesn't reply u email if he doens't feel like to. He doesn't tell u the midterm dates on the first day of class, nor the range for the midterms.
Fantastic, really made the course interesting. Always helpful if you have any questions, and a very fair marker.
Excellent professor, enjoyable class, great personality. Would love to take any course with him again, thank you...
Nice prof with good notes. Fair exam
Excellent Prof.  Such a teacher heart!!!!
Good prof!
Good prof. Recommended
She'll make you taking notes through the whole semester. Very unclear lecture!!

Relatively young and better looking, responsive to email queries, easy and clear exams.  She is pretty much the only person who can hear the lecturer, but she make that up with tons of notes.  Textbook for geeks only, laptop/typewriter is a must.
it's a easy course ... just read her notes----that's basicly everything u need to do to get an A.
Writes way too fast and hard to understand.
Midterm is okay, but her teaching ability is a problem. I guess a person who doesnt know Economics can be my professor. Fang just copied what the book is talking about.
Very good teacher, and straight forward notes.  Enjoyable class.
Clear notes, but can't listen to her because of her non-stop note writting.
straight forward. easy quiz

What a terrific professor. Very well prepared. If you have a question, he will really help you understand it. His test are fair. He makes it very clear what he expects for answers. If you need something remarked, he is very fair about it. I definitely recommend him. Refreshing to see a professor who genuinely enjoys teaching.
He is a nice guy. his final and MT is fair. You will doing fine if you really study on his note
The class average is about 64.
His exam is true or false and short answers. The exam is fair and mid 2 is easy.

He is not the worst Econ prof I've had at SFU. He seems to be a good person, but he lacks the skills of teaching and his accent makes it even more difficult to understand him. If you take his class, you'll have to read the book and study the lecture notes by yourself ...

USELESS PROF does not know how to teach, this is a self taught course. His exams are extremely easy (studied one day before each exam, and got the highest mark in the class) yet the averages were like 50%. I don't feel prepared for ECON 305. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
He make the students confused with either the course material or his lecture notes
Extremely helpful with his Cantonese accent~

UMMM./. he is okay prof..nice prof..but sometimes a bit unorganized. i brutally failed the first exam because didn't really know how his exams are.but by the end i As the second midterm and final because i read the notes...
His ok i guess. As long as you study his notes...you will be ok for his exams...however.... questions are tricky at times so beware
very articulate and intelligent... test you on your true understanding in exams... Hey what's not to love?
Good Professor~ Helpful and nice. Attend his lectures, copys the notes and understands!(Is a must) Fair midterm x2 and confusing final x 1.
Very Cute~ I like him~ Notes were extremely clear, two midterms were ok, BUT!! Final was extremely HARD!!!!! too hard...you should be careful for his final!! Otherwise, you will be in trouble.

I want to curse all the people who told me to take a course with him... Hard and confusing exams. Materials based on the notes, and the notes aren't that much of help for me. The course workload is like 'none'. You can't really do any practice in this course other than going over past midterms. Are you genius? then you can try his courses.
His exam is extremely challenging. I was in his tutorial in the summer semester, very bad experience. Even the T.A taught better then him. However, extremely low work load.

If you get higher than a B+ for either Econ 103 or Econ 290, avoid this course. This course has minimum course load - two midterms and one final - but the materials are unclear and self-contradictory. Thought this was a GPA booster, but it ended up otherwise. AVOID Junjie with this course if you are good at  microeconomics.
His notes are really all you need for this course. No surprises on the midterm or final if you study those and do the assignments.

Junjie is an excellent professor whose lecture notes were clearly and concisely laid out each class. His midterms and final exam (although final was challenging) almost perfectly reflected what was taught in the lectures making it very easy to follow along during the sem. and study for exams. I'm taking another class w/ him b/c he's THAT good.

A nice teacher would like to devote lot of time to make his student clearify the course materials. his notes is very helpful, it save my money on my textbookA_A. midterm makes u feel u are the smartest person and final makes u like an idioit.

Junjie is friendly and his notes are exactly what he talks about in lectures. His notes are pretty much summaries of the text so if you understand the notes no need to read the book. His midterms were easy but his final was a killer.
A very good professor... Like him
